item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Jukey Jukey
item.description:
@Jukey wrote:

Liquid Magic:

no one is going to answer this because it does not make any sense. when you run the java compiler do you see errors on the console?

why does it makes no sense and yes

client.java:540: cannot find symbol symbol : variable attackingnpc location : clas client int EnemyX = server.npcHandler.npcs[Attackingnpc].absX; ^ the "^" is under the "a" client.java:541: cannot find symbol symbol : variable attackingnpc location: class client int enemyY = server.npcHandler.npcs[Attackingnpc].absY ^

the “^” is under the “A”

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Jukey Jukey
item.description:
@Jukey wrote:

Hey ,
I need some help
their is an anti leech in this code
but i can’t find it so
i’m new but yea :d
help mee please

public void DropArrows() { int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX; int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY; if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4214 && playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] != 0) if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) == 0) { ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, 1, playerId, false); } else if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) != 0) { int amount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY); ItemHandler.removeItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount); ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount + 1, playerId, false); } } public void DropArrowsNPC() { int EnemyX = server.npcHandler.npcs[Attackingnpc].absX; int EnemyY = server.npcHandler.npcs[Attackingnpc].absY; if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4214 && playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] != 0) if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) == 0) { ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, 1, playerId, false); } else if (ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY) != 0) { int amount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY); ItemHandler.removeItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount); ItemHandler.addItem(playerEquipment[playerArrows], EnemyX, EnemyY, amount + 1, playerId, false); } }

Read full topic
